technology.short_description: As regiments gain renown, their standards become talismans that are just as important as their sword-arms.
State Troops are often issued with armour plate to ensure unit cohesion and a reasonable level of protection.
Industrialised production of ammunition for handguns has allowed the Empire to hoard large supplies.

effects.description: Reload time reduction: +10% for Missile units

technology.short_description: Fixing arms atop mounts and rides does away with the need to dismount and set up prior to firing, in turn reducing vulnerability and increasing efficiency.

effects.description: Missile resistance: 10% for Pistoliers and Outriders units
Missile strength: +10% for Pistoliers and Outriders units

technology.short_description: Thicker plates for riders and scaled barding for their mounts, meaning a greater percentage survive to charge again.
Riding for days whilst bearing full kit increases one's stamina for the real thing.

effects.description: Vigour loss reduction: -20% for cavalry units

technology.short_description: When the enemy might be an enormous monster taller than the highest spire, it's a good idea not to run out of ammo!
By fundamentally redesigning how field guns are constructed, we can maximise the firepower of each machine while saving resources in less important areas.
A more efficient way of transferring force from gas under pressure speeds up the production process, meaning more steam-powered weapons ready for the fight.

effects.description: Speed: +20% for Steam Tank, Luminark and Land Ship units
Unit mass: +20% for Steam Tank, Luminark and Land Ship units
Charge bonus: +20 for Steam Tank, Luminark and Land Ship units

technology.short_description: The Priests atop the Luminark hone their chants and prayers, offering greater protection to those around them.

effects.description: Passive ability: "Aura of Protection Upgraded" for Luminark units

enabled_if: Winds of magic power is 15 or greater

technology.short_description: Born as the twin-tailed comet blazed in the sky, Sigmar Heldenhammer united the tribes of warring humans and founded the Empire, and according to the cult of Sigmar, was elevated to Godhood.

effects.description: Control: +2 in own provinces where an army is present
Allows to chose one of four factionwide army abilities
Enable recruitment: Army of Sigmar units
Only one major deity can be chosen from this group!

technology.short_description: The Imperial God of War, Winter, and Wolves, who has ever protected the northern regions of the Empire from its enemies.

effects.description: Control: +2 in own provinces where an army is present
Global recruitment duration: -1 turn for all units
Allows to chose one of four factionwide army abilities
Enable recruitment: Sons of Ulric units
Only one major deity can be chosen from this group!

technology.short_description: Although the cost falls to each individual soldier, it is expected that all will use standardised equipment.

effects.description: Melee attack: +4 for Melee Infantry units
Melee defence: +4 for Melee Infantry units

technology.short_description: Refined ore techniques create stronger steel, making for more durable blades and heavier weapon-heads.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% for Melee Infantry units
"Imperial Allegiance" melee damage reflection for infantry units

technology.short_description: Gunnery units, archers and crossbowmen are well trained in their crafts, learning not only to hit their marks, but how to avoid becoming targets themselves.

effects.description: Missile resistance: 10% for Missile Infantry units
Missile strength: +10% for Missile Infantry units

technology.short_description: The discovery of barrel-rifling led to increases in speed and accuracy. Both Dwarfs and men claim credit for this invention.
What a mount cannot see will not spook them, ensuring every charge hits the target squarely.
The Knights of the Inner Circle are the elite of the elite, amongst the best fighting men of the Empire.

effects.description: Attribute: Immune to Psychology for Cavalry units

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

technology.short_description: Packing a wallop when they strike, artillery crews are also measured on their firing rates; the faster the better.

effects.description: Reload time reduction: +10% for Artillery units

technology.short_description: "An eighth of an ounce of this, a pinch of that, and half a pound of the other and… Boom! We have ignition!"

effects.description: Missile Explosion Radius: +20% for Artillery units

technology.short_description: Even the largest hulking war machine can be made more resilient to attack.

effects.description: Attribute: Ballistic Plating for Steam Tank units

related_attributes.bullet_text: Clad in heavy plates designed specifically to protect against projectiles, this unit is capable of deflecting even direct cannon fire!

effects.description: Armour: +10 for Steam Tank and Land Ship units
Missile resistance: 10% for Steam Tank and Land Ship units

technology.short_description: The height of Imperial Engineering; just having these machines on the battlefield rallies nearby troops to sweeping pride!

effects.description: Casualty replenishment rate: +10% for Artillery units
Local Recruitment duration: -2 turn for Steam Tank, Luminark and Land Ship units (minimum 1)
Attribute: Encourage for Steam Tank, Luminark and Land Ship units

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

technology.short_description: When he was a man, none could stand before his wrath. As a God ascended, none ever will.

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

attributes.bullet_text: This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

technology.short_description: Every Ulrican can fight, but when they receive their God’s blessing, they become the most fearsome warriors in the world.

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

technology.short_description: An army can only march as far as its supplies will last. Wagons loaded with goods allow for larger forces.
This joint-stock enterprise, if the trade winds prevail, is bound to make both factors and shareholders filthy, stinking rich. Amen.

effects.description: Income from Iron, Gem and Gold Mines: +20%

technology.short_description: The greatest minds of the Old World are gathered by the Empire’s various institutions to impart their knowledge and methods of efficiency.
There's always a new market to be tapped, or a fresh approach to existing ones.
This colonial campus maintains the high standards taught within the Imperial Colleges of Magic back home.

effects.description: Hero recruit rank: +5 for Empire Captains

technology.short_description: Lords rule and live well, peasants work themselves to death and must pay for the privilege – it's the perfect model for any truly forward-looking society.

effects.description: [HIDDEN - do not translate] Used to increase lord rank when replacing a lord (target the effect at forces factionwide) - use in conjunction with a shown effect that targets provinces factionwide

target_if: Unit is not Lord or Hero

technology.short_description: Intelligence shared is intelligence doubled.

effects.description: Hero recruit rank: +5 for Witch Hunters

technology.short_description: The Warden of the White Tower is known to many as the most powerful Wizard the mortal world has ever seen; fortunately, he imparts his wisdom gladly.

effects.description: Construction time: -50% for Battle Wizard recruitment buildings

technology.short_description: The Supreme Patriarch protects and guides the Colleges, ensuring dangerous magics are kept tightly under control.
It is in the Hall of Duels that a new Patriarch is decided and each Wizard must prove their worth.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -10% for all spells
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +10

technology.short_description: Sigmar’s will and determination will manifest within all loyal soldiers of the Empire, allowing them to banish evil from this world.

attributes.bullet_text:
This unit is permanently visible to the enemy, regardless of line of sight.
	
	Revealed units are not affected by the following attributes:
	 Hide Forest
	 Stalk
	 Unspottable
The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

technology.short_description: In the North, even on a calm day, those who threaten the Empire will find themselves at the mercy of Ulric’s wrath
It's comforting for people to know where their next meal will come from when winter's chill descends.
Interchangeable parts and constant work shifts ensure production targets are met or even exceeded.
This progressive assembly enables swifter production of all manner of industrial goods.
The Imperial Architects are an eccentric bunch who have always had, well, let's say 'fanciful' ideas about how a building should look…
One god, one way, many agents to guarantee compliance in defence of the faith.

effects.description: Hero recruit rank: +5 for Warrior Priests

technology.short_description: Being able to share acquired knowledge among your peers can only lead to better results all round.
Long ago, Teclis founded the eight Colleges of Magic; ever since, human Wizards have gathered to learn and practise their craft.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve: +2 per turn
Hero recruit rank: +5 for Battle Wizards

technology.short_description: As a young man, Sigmar was once sent to Morr’s gate, though he did not pass through. As a God, he can persuade his faithful to delay their passage.

effects.description: Army ability: "Safeguard of the Black gate"

target_if: Unit is not Lord or Hero

attributes.bullet_text: This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

technology.short_description: The God of Wolves has many servants, and many forms.

ui_effects.localised_text: Summon the White Wolf (aspect of Ulric that deals massive damage to single entities in melee and have attack aura for allies)

technology.short_description: No creature, no matter how fell, can withstand the will of Sigmar.
With reckless abandon, Ulric’s followers throw themselves into battle.

attributes.bullet_text:
A Rampaging unit is uncontrollable and will attack the nearest enemy unit.
	When there are no enemy units nearby, a Rampaging unit will move around randomly instead.

technology.short_description: A minor member of the Imperial aristocracy he may be, but the Emperor's ambassador knows exactly what to say, and how to say it, to guarantee a favourable outcome to proceedings.
Successful dealings with the lofty, aloof Asur takes a certain type of individual if awkward diplomatic misunderstandings are to be avoided.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve minimum: +20

technology.short_description: Diplomatic and discreet, this one knows exactly how to deal with fiery Dwarfen temperaments, so is well placed to run the Imperial embassy to the Everlasting Realm.

effects.description: Construction cost: -10% for Province Capital/Settlement buildings
Construction time: -1 for Province Capital/Settlement buildings

technology.short_description: Foul Greenskins, flea-infested Skaven, gluttonous Ogres and slimy Lizardmen are abroad in sufficient numbers that an organised cull is now necessary.

effects.description: Leadership: +4 when fighting against Greenskins, Skaven, Ogres and Lizardmen
Melee defence: +4 when fighting against Greenskins, Skaven, Ogres and Lizardmen

technology.short_description: There may be fell Necromancy afoot, for the Undead and Unliving infest Imperial territory in too greater numbers, hastening the need for an immediate purge.

effects.description: Melee attack: +4 when fighting against Undead

technology.short_description: “The damned will fear us as we push forwards with unbridled wrath – AND THEY WILL BE DESTROYED!”

effects.description: Effect range: +25% for "Grand Hammer of Sigmar"
Effect range: +25% for "Grand Shield of Faith"

technology.short_description: Always the first into battle on the charge, these elite troops aim for the very heart of the foe.

effects.description:
Unlocks recruitment of the following Elector Count State Troops:
	Teutogen Guard (Greatswords) 
	Imperial Foot (Foot Reiksguard)

technology.short_description: Braced for the onslaught, these extensively-drilled spearmen hold fast in the face of the enemy.

effects.description:
Unlocks recruitment of the following Elector Count State Troops:
	Eldred's Guard (Spearmen – Shields)
	Nordland Mariners (Free Company Militia)

technology.short_description: Those who dare approach Imperial battle lines must face multiple hails of arrows before the first blow is even struck.

effects.description:
Unlocks recruitment of the following Elector Count State Troops:
	Stir River Patrol (Crossbowmen)
	Gunderman's Surefires (Handgunners)

technology.short_description: Those who dare approach Imperial battle lines must face multiple hails of arrows before the first blow is even struck.

effects.description:
Unlocks recruitment of the following Elector Count State Troops:
	Stir River Patrol (Crossbowmen)
	Gunderman's Surefires (Handgunners)

technology.onscreen_name: Ambassador to the Royarch of Bretonnia
technology.short_description: Deferent and respectful, the embassy to Bretonnia understands perfectly the customs and traditions of this ancient feudal society.
Grand Cathay is home to many wonders, many of which could be put to good use by the Empire.

effects.description: Income from trade: +2% for every ally

technology.short_description: Unintelligent though they are, one cannot deny the usefulness and power of having a mighty Ogre Tyrant on side.
These lands belong to the Empire – those arrogant, knife-eared Elves must be driven back to their own dominion, and with haste!

effects.description: Missile resistance: 10% when fighting against Elves

technology.short_description: The taint of Chaos has been observed here; such things must not be allowed to gain a foothold and be removed without delay!

effects.description: Leadership: +4 when fighting against Norsca, Warriors of Chaos, Chaos Dwarfs, Daemons of Chaos and Beastmen
Weapon strength: +10% for all units when fighting against Norsca, Warriors of Chaos, Chaos Dwarfs, Daemons of Chaos and Beastmen

technology.short_description: As more and more accursed books are sealed, bigger and bigger temples are built, and Sigmar’s blessings smile upon us.

effects.description: Dauntless Fury: Arch Lectors and Flagellants (scaling damage in battle)

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with time spent engaged in melee (150s)

effects.description: Pursuit of Battle: Warrior Priests and Sigmarite Disciples (scaling defence in battle)

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with time spent engaged in melee (150s)

technology.short_description: These men's superior engineering skills are matched only by their martial prowess, as evidenced by the explosions that ring around the battlefield during the combat.

effects.description:
Unlocks recruitment of the following Elector Count State Troops:
	Sootson's Guns (Mortars)
	Wissenburg's Welcomers (War Wagon - Grenade Launchers)

technology.short_description: These advanced horsemen ensure that the enemy's numbers are fewer than intended when battle is finally joined.

effects.description:
Unlocks recruitment of the following Elector Count State Troops:
	The Noble Sons Abroad (Pistoliers)
	The Bordermen (Handgunners)

technology.short_description: Those who try to escape the fray will find their flanks blocked by noble steel, ranged against the foe in the Emperor's name.

effects.description:
Unlocks recruitment of the following Elector Count State Troops:
	Knights of Morr (Empire Knights)
	Knights of the Everlasting Light (Empire Knights)
	The Stubborn Bulls (Empire Knights – Greatswords)

technology.short_description: Those who try to escape the fray will find their flanks blocked by noble steel, ranged against the foe in the Emperor's name.

effects.description:
Unlocks recruitment of the following Elector Count State Troops:
	Knights of Morr (Empire Knights)
	Knights of the Everlasting Light (Empire Knights)
	The Stubborn Bulls (Empire Knights – Greatswords)

technology.short_description: Morr defends the souls of the departed, and protects the minds of dreamers.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +10% when attacking
	(all characters factionwide)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.

effects.description: Only one minor deity can be chosen from this group!

technology.short_description: Verena values Justice and Knowledge, and is the patron God of the fair and wise.

effects.description: Only one minor deity can be chosen from this group!

technology.short_description: The God of Nature and Lord of Beasts, worshipped by hunters and rangers, is extremely temperamental. His rages, when turned against the enemies of his followers, can be devastating.

effects.description: Attrition: -25% casualties suffered from all attrition
Only one minor deity can be chosen from this group!

technology.short_description: The Goddess of Fertility, Earth, and Love, and wife of Taal, Rhya provides favorable conditions to the farmers and ranchers who worship her, and protects them from her husband’s rage.

effects.description: Only one minor deity can be chosen from this group!

technology.short_description: The Goddess of Strategy and War, Myrmidia values military professionalism, with an emphasis on proper utilization of strategy, tactics, and obedience.

effects.description: Only one minor deity can be chosen from this group!

technology.short_description: The Imperial God of the Seas and Tides, it would be unwise to venture into his domain without properly worshipping him.

effects.description: Only one minor deity can be chosen from this group!

technology.short_description: The Goddess of Healing and Mercy, her temples are a haven for the poor and sick. Often, those that turn to her temples for mercy will ultimately find comfort in the care of her father, Morr.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -20% for Lore of Life spells
Only one minor deity can be chosen from this group!

technology.short_description: The Trickster God is the patron of thieves, conmen, and gamblers, and rewards those who are particularly clever. He abhors the pomp and majesty associated with most other cults.

effects.description: Magic item drop chance from battle: +100%
Only one minor deity can be chosen from this group!
